00058 CSocket::CSocket() {
00059   m_sock = INVALID_SOCKET;
00060  }
00061 
00062 
00063 CSocket::~CSocket() {
00064   if (m_sock != INVALID_SOCKET)
00065     Close();
00066  }
00067 
00068 
00069 void CSocket::Close() {
00070   if (m_sock != INVALID_SOCKET) {
00071     closesocket(m_sock);
00072     m_sock = INVALID_SOCKET;
00073    }
00074  }
00075 
00076 
00077 void CSocket::SetNonBlock() {
00078 #ifdef WIN32
00079   unsigned long val = 1;
00080   ioctlsocket(m_sock, FIONBIO, &val);
00081 #else
00082   int val = fcntl(m_sock, F_GETFL, 0);
00083   val |= O_NONBLOCK;
00084   fcntl(m_sock, F_SETFL, val);
00085 #endif
00086  }
00087 
00088 
00089 void CSocket::SetBlock() {
00090 #ifdef WIN32
00091   unsigned long val = 0;
00092   ioctlsocket(m_sock, FIONBIO, &val);
00093 #else
00094   int val = fcntl(m_sock, F_GETFL, 0);
00095   val &= ~O_NONBLOCK;
00096   fcntl(m_sock, F_SETFL, val);
00097 #endif
00098  }

00105 CClientSock::CClientSock() {
00106   input_top = output_top = inGroup = groupSize = 0;
00107   pExtraData = NULL;
00108   char name[256];
00109   struct hostent *h;
00110         #ifdef SOLARIS
00111         sysinfo(SI_HOSTNAME, name, 256);
00112         #else
00113   gethostname(name, 256);
00114         #endif
00115   h = gethostbyname(name);
00116   ipaddr = ntohl(*((int *)(*((int *)h->h_addr_list))));
00117  }

00120 CClientSock::CClientSock(SOCKET s) {
00121   fEncrypt = 0;
00122   input_top = output_top = inGroup = groupSize = 0;
00123   m_sock = s;
00124   pExtraData = NULL;
00125  }

00132 
00133 void CClientSock::Write(char *data, int size) {
00134   unsigned int num;
00135   if (output_top+size > SOCK_OUTPUT_SIZE) {
00136                 assert(0);
00137     // handle trying to write when output buffer is full
00138    }
00139   else {
00140     if (fEncrypt) {
00141       while (size--) {
00142         #ifndef DO_ENCRYPT
00143         output_buffer[output_top++] = *data;
00144         #else
00145         #ifdef BIGENDIAN
00146         output_buffer[output_top++] = *data ^ *(((char *)(&encryptCode[0]))+3);
00147         #else
00148         output_buffer[output_top++] = *data ^ *((char *)(&encryptCode[0]));
00149         #endif
00150         #endif
00151         data++;
00152         num = encryptCode[1]<<31;
00153         encryptCode[1] = ((encryptCode[1]>>1)|(encryptCode[0]<<31)) ^ 0xf1a372d5;
00154         encryptCode[0] = ((encryptCode[0]>>1)|(num))                ^ 0x3a1fd527;
00155        }
00156      }
00157     else {
00158       memcpy(output_buffer+output_top, data, size);
00159       output_top += size;
00160      }
00161    }
00162  }
00163 
00164 
00165 int CClientSock::Connect(unsigned int ip, unsigned short port) {
00166   struct sockaddr_in sockaddress; 
00167   int x = 1;
00168 
00169   // clear out buffers in case this is a reconnect
00170   // also reset encryption and packet number
00171   input_top = output_top = inGroup = groupSize = 0;
00172 
00173   sockaddress.sin_addr.s_addr = htonl(ip);
00174   sockaddress.sin_port = htons(port);
00175   if ((m_sock = socket(AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, 0)) == INVALID_SOCKET) {
00176           #ifdef WIN32
00177     OutputDebugString("socket creation failed");
00178                 #endif
00179     return 0;
00180    }
00181 
00182 #ifdef ALLOW_SMALL_PACKETS
00183   #ifdef TCP_NODELAY
00184   setsockopt(m_sock, IPPROTO_TCP, TCP_NODELAY, (char *) &x, sizeof(x));
00185   #endif
00186 #endif
00187 
00188   sockaddress.sin_family = AF_INET;
00189   if (connect(m_sock, (struct sockaddr *)&sockaddress, sizeof(sockaddress))) {
00190           #ifdef WIN32
00191     //OutputDebugString("connect failed");
00192                 #endif
00193     closesocket(m_sock);
00194     m_sock = INVALID_SOCKET;
00195     return 0;
00196    }
00197   if (!standAloneIP) {
00198     fEncrypt = 1;
00200 
00201                 if (!uniqueCdKey)
00202                 {
00203                         // The real account number gets transmitted to the client with the
00204                         // USER_SERVER packet. The encryptCode is reset and transmitted back
00205                         // to the user server.
00206       uniqueCdKey = ipaddr;
00207                 }
00209 
00210         int other = ~uniqueCdKey;
00211 
00212     encryptCode[0] = ((uniqueCdKey&0x0000ffff)^0x0000aaaa)
00213                    | ((other     <<16       )^0x13570000);
00214     encryptCode[1] = ((other     &0xffff0000)^0xabcd0000)
00215                    | ((uniqueCdKey>>16       )^0x00004321);
00216     encryptCode[2] = ((uniqueCdKey&0xf0f0f0f0)^0xa06020e0)
00217                    | ((other     &0x0f0f0f0f)^0x070e050a);
00218     encryptCode[3] = ((other     &0xf0f0f0f0)^0xf0b03090)
00219                    | ((uniqueCdKey&0x0f0f0f0f)^0x040c010d);
00220     SetBlock();
00221     unsigned int cdkey = htonl(uniqueCdKey);
00222     send(m_sock, (char *)&cdkey, 4, 0);
00223    }
00224   else
00225     fEncrypt = 0;
00226   SetNonBlock();
00227 
00228         return 1;
00229  }
00230 
00231 extern BOOL attemptedLogin;
00232 int waitedTicks = 0;
00233 const int FRAMES_PER_RECONNECT=13;
00234 const int MS_PER_FRAME=(1000/13);
00235 
00236 void CClientSock::Handle_Link_Loss(char *reason)
00237 {
00238         extern void ChooseServer();
00239         extern unsigned int serverIP;
00240         extern unsigned short serverPort;
00241     
00242         if (attemptedLogin)
00243         {
00244                 if (GumpManager.pLoginStatusGump == NULL)
00245                 {               
00246                         GumpManager.pLoginStatusGump = GumpManager.ErrorGump("Connection lost", NULL, FALSE, TRUE);
00247                 }
00248 
00249                 waitedTicks--;
00250                 if (waitedTicks <= 0)
00251                 {               
00252                         waitedTicks = FRAMES_PER_RECONNECT;
00253                         delete App.pSock;
00254                         App.pSock = new CClientSock;
00255                         ChooseServer();
00256                         App.pSock->Connect(serverIP, serverPort);
00257                         if(App.pSock->m_sock != INVALID_SOCKET) {
00258                          // this will delete the connection lost gump
00259                          Do_PreLogin(App.name, App.password, App.currentChar);
00260                          }      
00261                 }
00262 
00263                 GraphicManager.Draw_Map_Isometric();
00264     #ifdef WIN32
00265                 Sleep(MS_PER_FRAME);
00266     #else
00267     usleep(MS_PER_FRAME*1000);
00268     #endif
00269         }      
00270 }

00272 
00273 void CClientSock::SelectPoll() {
00274   fd_set inp_set, out_set, exc_set;
00275   static struct timeval null_time;
00276   int thesize, rc, i;
00277 
00278   if (m_sock == INVALID_SOCKET) {
00279     if (!programShutdown)
00280       Handle_Link_Loss("dunno, select with invalid socket");
00281     return;
00282    }
00283 
00284   // clear out descriptor sets
00285   FD_ZERO(&inp_set);
00286   FD_ZERO(&out_set);
00287   FD_ZERO(&exc_set);
00288   
00289   // add socket to input set (check for new connections)
00290   FD_SET(m_sock, &inp_set);
00291   if (output_top > 0)
00292     FD_SET(m_sock, &out_set);
00293   FD_SET(m_sock, &exc_set);
00294   // poll the descriptors
00295   
00296   if (select((int)m_sock+1, &inp_set, &out_set, &exc_set, &null_time) == SOCKET_ERROR) {
00297     return;
00298    }
00299 
00300   if (FD_ISSET(m_sock, &exc_set)) {
00301     // handle exception states
00302     // close socket and handle link loss
00303     Close();
00304     Handle_Link_Loss("exception state on socket");
00305     return;
00306    }
00307   if (FD_ISSET(m_sock, &inp_set)) {
00308     // handle input
00309     do {
00310       thesize = SOCK_INPUT_SIZE - input_top;
00311       //
00312       if (thesize > 0) {         
00313         rc = recv(m_sock, input_buffer+input_top, thesize, 0);
00314         /*{
00315          char buf[10];
00316          sprintf(buf, "%d", rc);
00317          MessageBox(NULL, buf, "data received.", MB_OK);
00318         }*/
00319         if (rc == SOCKET_ERROR) {
00320           // close socket and handle link loss
00321           Close();
00322 #ifdef WIN32
00323           //char buff[512];
00324           //int lerr = WSAGetLastError();
00325           //sprintf(buff, "input_top %d, thesize %d, lasterror %d", input_top, thesize, lerr);
00326                                         //sprintf(buff, "The server you were connected to has crashed\nor was deliberately taken down.\nPlease try again later.");
00327           //MessageBox(NULL, buff, "Error Receiving Data from Server", MB_OK);
00328 #endif
00329           Handle_Link_Loss("Exiting due to closed connection.");
00330           return;
00331          }
00332         else {
00333           if (fEncrypt) {
00334             while (rc--) {
00335               #ifndef DO_ENCRYPT
00336               input_buffer[input_top++] ^= 0;
00337               #else
00338               #ifdef BIGENDIAN
00339               input_buffer[input_top++] ^= *(((char *)(&encryptCode[2]))+3);
00340               #else
00341               input_buffer[input_top++] ^= *((char *)(&encryptCode[2]));
00342               #endif
00343               #endif
00344               unsigned int num = encryptCode[3]>>31;
00345               encryptCode[3] = ((encryptCode[3]<<1)|(encryptCode[2]>>31))
00346                              ^ 0xfa7d5231;
00347               encryptCode[2] = ((encryptCode[2]<<1)|(num))
00348                              ^ 0xaf572d13;
00349              }
00350            }
00351           else
00352             input_top += rc;
00353          }
00354        }
00355       else
00356         rc = 0;
00357      } while (rc == thesize && thesize > 0);
00358    }
00359   if (FD_ISSET(m_sock, &out_set)) {
00360     // handle output
00361     output_buffer[output_top] = '\0';
00362     
00363     rc = send(m_sock, output_buffer, output_top, 0);
00364 
00365     if (rc == SOCKET_ERROR) {
00366       Close();
00367       Handle_Link_Loss("socket error in send");
00368       return;
00369      }
00370     if (rc > 0) {
00371       for (i = rc; i < output_top; i++)
00372       output_buffer[i-rc] = output_buffer[i];
00373      }
00374     output_top -= rc;
00375    }
00376   if (input_top > 0)
00377     Handle_Input();
00378  }

00403 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00404 
00405 void CClientSock::Handle_Input() {
00406   int size;
00407 
00408   if (input_top < groupSize+(int)sizeof(PDSTRUCT))
00409     return;
00410     
00411         while (input_top > groupSize+(int)sizeof(PDSTRUCT))  {
00412           PDSTRUCT *pPacket;
00413           pPacket = (PDSTRUCT *)(input_buffer+groupSize);
00414                 HostOrderSize(pPacket);
00415 
00416                 if (isPDStructVariable(pPacket))
00417                         size = getCurPacketSize(pPacket);
00418                 else
00419                         size = PacketTable[pPacket->type].size;
00420 
00421                 if (groupSize+size > SOCK_INPUT_SIZE) {
00422       assert(groupSize);
00423       // this would overfill the buffer to have such a group
00424       pPacket = (PDSTRUCT *)(((char *)pPacket)-groupSize);
00425       inGroup = 0;
00426       HandleGroupedPackets();
00427      }
00428 
00429     if (input_top < groupSize+size)  {
00430                         NetOrderSize(pPacket);
00431                         return;
00432                  }
00433     
00434                 // full packet is there, handle it
00435     if (inGroup)
00436                   DoHandlePacket(pPacket);
00437     else {
00438                   DoHandlePacket(pPacket);
00439                 for (int i = size; i < input_top; i++)
00440                         input_buffer[i-size] = input_buffer[i];
00441                   input_top -= size;
00442      }
00443          }
00444  }
00445

00447 GroupedPackets::GroupedPackets() {
00448   num = max = 0;
00449   packets = NULL;
00450  }
00451 
00452 
00453 GroupedPackets::~GroupedPackets() {
00454   if (packets)
00455     delete [] packets;
00456  }
00457 
00458 
00459 void CClientSock::AddGroupedPacket(PDSTRUCT *pPacket) {
00460 
00461   if (packetGroup.num >= packetGroup.max) {
00462     char **p = new char *[packetGroup.max+16];
00463     for (int i = 0; i < packetGroup.num; i++)
00464       p[i] = packetGroup.packets[i];
00465     delete [] packetGroup.packets;
00466     packetGroup.packets = p;
00467     packetGroup.max += 16;
00468    }
00469   int size;
00470   if (isPDStructVariable(pPacket))
00471           size = getCurPacketSize(pPacket);
00472         else
00473                 size = PacketTable[pPacket->type].size;
00474   assert(size);
00475   inGroup = 1;
00476   packetGroup.packets[packetGroup.num] = (char *)pPacket;
00477   packetGroup.num++;
00478   groupSize += size;
00479  }
00480 
00481 
00482 void CClientSock::HandleGroupedPackets() {
00483   int i;
00484 
00485   for (i = 0; i < packetGroup.num; i++)
00486     DoHandlePacket((PDSTRUCT *)packetGroup.packets[i]);
00487   packetGroup.num = 0;
00488 
00489   for (i = groupSize; i < input_top; i++)
00490                 input_buffer[i-groupSize] = input_buffer[i];
00491         input_top -= groupSize;
00492   groupSize = 0;
00493  }
00494 
00495 
00496 int lastPacketType = -1;

00498 
00499 void CClientSock::DoHandlePacket(PDSTRUCT *pPacket) {
00500 
00501   if (inGroup) {
00502     if (pPacket->type == PACKET_GROUP) {
00503       if (!((char *)pPacket)[1]) {
00504         inGroup = 0;
00505         groupSize += PDSTRUCT_GROUP_SIZE;
00506         HandleGroupedPackets();
00507        }
00508       else {
00509         // multiple packet group opens without a close
00510         // this can happen in some bizarre circumstances when crossing server boundaries
00511                 int size;
00512         if (isPDStructVariable(pPacket))
00513                         size = getCurPacketSize(pPacket);
00514                     else
00515                             size = PacketTable[pPacket->type].size;
00516         for (int i = groupSize+size; i < input_top; i++)
00517           input_buffer[i-size] = input_buffer[i];
00518         input_top -= size;
00519        }
00520       return;
00521      }
00522     AddGroupedPacket(pPacket);
00523     return;
00524    }
00525 
00526   switch (pPacket->type) {
00527                 case PACKET_GROUP:
00528       if (((char *)pPacket)[1])
00529         inGroup = 1;
00530                         break;
00531     case PACKET_MOVE:
00532       PacketManager.HandlePacket((PDSTRUCT_MOVE *)pPacket);
00533       break;
00534     case PACKET_NAKED_MOB:
00535       PacketManager.HandlePacket((PDSTRUCT_NAKED_MOB *)pPacket);
00536       break;
00537     case PACKET_EQUIPPED_MOB:
00538       PacketManager.HandlePacket((PDSTRUCT_EQUIPPED_MOB *)pPacket);
00539       break;
00540     case PACKET_ZMOVE:
00541       PacketManager.HandlePacket((PDSTRUCT_ZMOVE *)pPacket);
00542       break;
00543     case PACKET_BLOCKED_MOVE:
00544       PacketManager.HandlePacket((PDSTRUCT_BLOCKED_MOVE *)pPacket);
00545       break;
00546     case PACKET_OK_MOVE:
00547       PacketManager.HandlePacket((PDSTRUCT_OK_MOVE *)pPacket);
00548       break;
00549     case PACKET_TEXT:
00550       PacketManager.HandlePacket((PDSTRUCT_TEXT *)pPacket);
00551       break;
00552     case PACKET_LOGIN_CONFIRM:
00553       PacketManager.HandlePacket((PDSTRUCT_LOGIN_CONFIRM *)pPacket);
00554       break;
00555                 case PACKET_ACCT_LOGIN_OK:
00556       PacketManager.HandlePacket((PDSTRUCT_ACCT_LOGIN_OK *)pPacket);
00557       break;
00558                 case PACKET_ACCT_LOGIN_FAIL:
00559       PacketManager.HandlePacket((PDSTRUCT_ACCT_LOGIN_FAIL *)pPacket);
00560       break;
00561     case PACKET_SERVERCHANGE:
00562       PacketManager.HandlePacket((PDSTRUCT_SERVERCHANGE *)pPacket);
00563       break;
00564     case PACKET_DESTROY_OBJECT:
00565       PacketManager.HandlePacket((PDSTRUCT_DESTROY_OBJECT *)pPacket);
00566       break;
00567     case PACKET_OBJMOVE:
00568       PacketManager.HandlePacket((PDSTRUCT_OBJMOVE *)pPacket);
00569       break;
00570     case PACKET_OPEN_GUMP:
00571       PacketManager.HandlePacket((PDSTRUCT_OPEN_GUMP *)pPacket);
00572       break;
00573     case PACKET_OPEN_COURSEGUMP:
00574       PacketManager.HandlePacket((PDSTRUCT_OPEN_COURSEGUMP *)pPacket);
00575       break;

00577       PacketManager.HandlePacket((PDSTRUCT_OBJ_TO_OBJ *)pPacket);
00578       break;

00835 
00836 
00837 void CClientSock::SendPacket(PDSTRUCT *pPacket) {
00838   int size = getCurPacketSize(pPacket);
00839         NetOrderSize(pPacket);
00840   Write((char *)pPacket, size);
00841  }
